name: Handstand Push-Up
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a handstand position with your hands shoulder-width apart on the ground and your body forming an inverted V shape.

2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your hips do not sag or pike upwards throughout the movement.

3. Lower your head and torso towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides. Focus on using only your shoulder muscles to control the movement.

4. As you lower yourself down, maintain a tight body position with minimal sway in any direction.

5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement to ensure proper form.

6. Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your arms and pushing against the ground. Focus on using only your shoulder muscles to generate power for the push-up.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a tight body position throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Handstand push-ups are an upper body exercise that targets the shoulders, specifically the deltoids and trapezius muscles.
